meanings.definition: A device or software used to arrange and control the playback of musical sequences.
meanings.sent1: The sequencers in the studio helped create a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent2: Musicians often rely on sequencers to enhance their compositions.
meanings.sent3: The sequencers at the concert seemed to dance along with the music.
meanings.sent4: The sequencers acted like conductors, guiding each note to perfection.
meanings.sent5: The sequencers hummed softly as they worked their magic on the music.

meanings.definition: People or things that follow one another in a particular order.
meanings.sent1: The sequencers in the race crossed the finish line one after the other.
meanings.sent2: The sequencers in the parade marched in a neat line.
meanings.sent3: The sequencers of ducks waddled behind each other in a comical line.
meanings.sent4: The sequencers of cars on the highway resembled colorful beads on a string.
meanings.sent5: The sequencers of students entered the classroom in an orderly fashion.
